title: Font ID Please
content:
Sorry. I thought I found the answer. I am reposting my question.

I hope someone might be able to identify this font. Thanks.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071128112304im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Ambassadors_6094.jpg)

 [‹ Mt. Everest expedition 1924 altimeter font](http://web.archive.org/web/20071128112304/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39454 "Go to previous forum topic") [Fonts in this Logo ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071128112304/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39442 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Carlton Chin

comments.content: I think it’s not a font…

The client said it was but this was created before my time. I do not have much more to go on. Unfortunately the file is a vector EPS so it no longer retains any font information. But you could be right. It looks like it could have been hand drawn under closer examination. Need to break down the vector file more to make sure.... :(

I second Pieter … look at the two ‘a’ – they differ. And all three ‘s’ are different. If this was such an intelligent font with lots of alternates, they designer better would have used a final alternate ‘s’.
